evidence: Clear separation of concerns with distinct modules: apis, core, datasets, models, ops, utils
Hierarchical package structure with well-defined boundaries
Config-based approach with extensive configuration files organized by model types
Strong module isolation with builder patterns for components (backbones, heads, losses)
Comprehensive testing structure mirroring the source code organization
Dataset pipeline architecture with composable transforms
Model composition through encoder-decoder and cascade architectures
Low average fan-out (1.106) indicating loose coupling between modules
High maintainability index (92.42) suggesting good modular design
risks: Complex configuration management across many model variants
Potential for tight coupling through shared utility modules
Large number of configuration files may indicate architectural complexity
